00040 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00042 
00043 #ifndef PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_H
00044 #define PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_H
00045 
00046 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00047 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00048 
00049 #include "pizDataStructures.h"
00050 
00051 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 
00054 /** 
00055  * \remark  The arc from one node to next node (straight) is the first.
00056  * \ingroup factorOracle
00057  */
00058  
00059 typedef struct _PIZFactorOracleNode {
00060     long                referTo;                        /* Final index of longest repeated sequence. */
00061     long                lengthRepeatedSuffix;           /* Size of longest repeated sequence. */
00062     PIZGrowingArray     *arcDestinations;               /* Arc destinations indexes. */
00063     PIZGrowingArray     *arcValues;                     /* Arc values. */
00064     } PIZFactorOracleNode;
00065     
00066 /**
00067  * \remark  Implemented with dynamic array of nodes ; For each node, arcs are stored in dynamic arrays too.
00068             Node's dynamic arrays are created on the \a first query and keep in memory 
00069             until pizFactorOracleFree() is called.
00070  * \ingroup factorOracle
00071  */
00072      
00073 typedef struct _PIZFactorOracle {
00074     long                size;                           /* Current number of nodes allocated. */
00075     long                peak;                           /* Maximum number of nodes reached. */
00076     long                index;                          /* Current number of nodes. */
00077     long                shuttle;                        /* Index of the playback head. */
00078     long                backwardThreshold;              /* Threshold for backward playback. */
00079     double              straightRatio;                  /* Threshold for straight playback. */
00080     PIZFactorOracleNode *nodes;                         /* Array of nodes. */
00081     } PIZFactorOracle;
00082 
00083 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00085 
00086 PIZ_START_C_LINKAGE
00087 
00088 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 
00091 /**
00092  * \brief   Create the factor oracle.
00093  * \details The function currently do not need arguments (provided for later improvements).
00094  *          In case of failure the pointer is NULL.
00095  * \param   argc 0.
00096  * \param   argv NULL.
00097  * \return  A pointer to the new factor oracle.
00098  * \remark  The following shows how to create a factor oracle.  
00099  * \code
00100  * PIZFactorOracle *oracle = pizFactorOracleNew (0, NULL);
00101  *
00102  * \endcode
00103  * \ingroup factorOracle
00104  */
00105 PIZFactorOracle *pizFactorOracleNew (long argc, long *argv);
00106 
00107 /**
00108  * \brief   Free the factor oracle.
00109  * \details It is safe to pass NULL pointer. 
00110  * \param   x A Pointer.
00111  * \ingroup factorOracle
00112  */
00113 void pizFactorOracleFree (PIZFactorOracle *x);
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * \brief   Add values to the factor oracle.
00117  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00118  * \param   argc The number of values.
00119  * \param   argv A pointer to the values.
00120  * \return  An error code.
00121  * \remark  The number of allocated nodes is doubled in case of exceeding.
00122  * \ingroup factorOracle
00123  */
00124 PIZError pizFactorOracleAdd (PIZFactorOracle *x, long argc, long *argv);
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * \brief   Clear the factor oracle.
00128  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00129  * \ingroup factorOracle
00130  */
00131 void pizFactorOracleClear (PIZFactorOracle *x);
00132 
00133 /**
00134  * \brief   Fill a given array with factor oracle values.
00135  * \remark  Each step a number between 0. and 1. is randomly drawn : 
00136  *          if it is inferior to the straightRatio the playback head moves straight, 
00137  *          otherwise, there is half chance to moves backward (if backward threshold is reached), 
00138  *          and half chance to moves forward (if arcs exist).
00139  *
00140  * \param   argc Number of step to proceed.
00141  * \param   argv Pointer to the array.
00142  * \return  An error code.
00143  * \ingroup factorOracle
00144  */
00145 PIZError pizFactorOracleProceed (PIZFactorOracle *x, long argc, long *argv);
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * \brief   Get the number of nodes in the factor oracle.
00149  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00150  * \return  The number of nodes.
00151  * \ingroup factorOracle
00152  */
00153 long pizFactorOracleCount (const PIZFactorOracle *x);
00154

00156 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00159 
00160 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00161 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00162 #endif // PIZ_FACTOR_ORACLE_H
